Class QuickFoodMS

java.lang.Object
QuickFoodMS
public class QuickFoodMS extends Object
This is a project management system for a fictional food delivery company called Food Quick. The purpose of this system is to keep track of the orders that they are working on at any given time.
Since:
2022-07-18
Version:
QuickFoodMS-1.0.0
Author:
Johann Jansen van Vuuren

  • Constructor Details

    • QuickFoodMS

      public QuickFoodMS()

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      The main method from where all other methods will be invoked based on the user's menu choice.
      Parameters:
      args - Main method.

    • captureNewOrder

      public static void captureNewOrder(Connection connection, Scanner input) throws SQLException
      A method to capture new orders. This method will check if a customer is already in the database and if not it will divert the user to the createNewCustomer method in the Customer class.
      Parameters:
      connection - The Connection instance from the main method needed for PreparedStatement.
      input - The Scanner instance from main needed for the readUserInput and readUserInputInteger methods.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If underlying MySQL service fails.

    • addItemsToExistingOrder

      public static void addItemsToExistingOrder(Connection connection, Scanner input) throws SQLException
      A method to add items to the items-order table and then to update the order in the orders table. It makes use of the returnOrderNumber and updateWithNewItems methods from the Order class as well as addItemToOrder from the ItemsOrder class.
      Parameters:
      connection - The Connection resource from the main method needed as a parameter for the invocation of the class methods.
      input - The Scanner instance from the main method needed for the two invocation of the UserInput methods that require the instance as arguments when invoked.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If the underlying MySQL service fails.

    • findAndDisplayOrder

      public static void findAndDisplayOrder(Connection connection, Scanner input) throws SQLException
      This method locates and display the order information based on user input. It can locate the order by either order number or customer names.
      Parameters:
      connection - The Connection resource from the main method needed for the connection arguments of both method calls.
      input - The Scanner instance from the main method needed for user input by the Order.returnOrderNumber method call.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If the underlying MySQL service fails.

    • listOrdersWithIncompleteInfo

      public static void listOrdersWithIncompleteInfo(Connection connection) throws SQLException
      A method to find and display orders and/or customers with incomplete information in the database.
      Parameters:
      connection - The Connection resource from the main method needed for the invocation of all the class methods.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If the underlying MySQL service fails.

    • listPendingOrders

      public static void listPendingOrders(Connection connection) throws SQLException
      This method finds and list pending orders based on the finalised field in the orders table. It uses two utility methods from the Order class to do so. "findPendingOrders" and "displayOrder".
      Parameters:
      connection - The Connection resource from the main method needed for the invocation of the utility methods.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If the underlying MySQL service fails.

    • ordersAllocatedToDriver

      public static void ordersAllocatedToDriver(Connection connection, Scanner input) throws SQLException
      This method finds and lists all the orders associated with a specific driver. It uses utility methods from the Driver and Order classes to do so. These methods are findDriverId, findDriverName and findOrdersAllocatedToDriver from the Driver class and displayOrder from the Order class.
      Parameters:
      connection - The Connection resource from the main method that is needed as arguments for the utility methods that are invoked.
      input - The Scanner instance from the main method that is needed as an argument for the utility methods that are invoked.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If the underlying MySQL service fails.

    • finaliseOrder

      public static void finaliseOrder(Connection connection, Scanner input) throws SQLException
      A method to update the status of an order to "finalised" when the order has been completed and paid for. It does this with the help of the utility method in Order class, makeFinal.
      Parameters:
      connection - The Connection resource from the main method needed when invoking the helper method from the Order class.
      input - The Scanner instance from the main method needed to read input from the user with the help of the UserInput class.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If the underlying MySQL service fails.

    • captureNewCustomer

      public static void captureNewCustomer(Connection connection, Scanner input) throws SQLException
      The capturing of new customers are handled by this method. It does so via the createNewCustomer utility method in the Customer class.
      Parameters:
      connection - The Connection resource from the main method that is needed as an argument when calling the utility method.
      input - The Scanner instance from the main method that is needed to read user input via the UserInput class.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If the underlying MySQL service fails

    • updateCustomer

      public static void updateCustomer(Connection connection, Scanner input) throws SQLException
      A method that allows the user to update any of the fields in the customer table. This is done via the performFieldUpdate utility method in the Customer class.
      Parameters:
      connection - The Connection resource from the main method needed here for the invocation of theCustomer.performFieldUpdate method.
      input - The Scanner instance from the main method needed for invocation of the UserInput class' methods.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If the underlying MySQL service fails.

    • captureNewRestaurant

      public static void captureNewRestaurant(Connection connection, Scanner input) throws SQLException
      A method that captures a new restaurant completely through the createNewRestaurant method in the class Restaurant. It was structured like this so that all functionalities of the program are kept in the same file as the main method that invokes them.
      Parameters:
      connection - The Connection resource from the main method that is needed as an argument when invoking "Restaurant.createNewRestaurant".
      input - The Scanner instance from the main method that is also needed for the invocations.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If the underlying MySQL service fails.

    • updateRestaurant

      public static void updateRestaurant(Connection connection, Scanner input) throws SQLException
      A method that updates any details associated with a restaurant. It does this in conjunction with the performFieldUpdate method from class Restaurant.
      Parameters:
      connection - The Connection resource from the main method needed here for the performFieldUpdate invocation.
      input - The Scanner instance from the main method needed here to read input with the help of the UserInput utility class.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If the underlying MySQL service fails.

    • addNewItem

      public static void addNewItem(Connection connection, Scanner input) throws SQLException
      A method to add new items to the menu. It uses the createNewItem method from the Item class to do so. It is structured to be in the same file as the main method because all functionalities of the program is invoked from there.
      Parameters:
      connection - The Connection resource from the main method, needed as an argument when invoking createNewItem.
      input - The Scanner instance from the main menu needed for the invocation of createNewItem as well.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If the underlying MySQL service fails.

    • editItem

      public static void editItem(Connection connection, Scanner input) throws SQLException
      This method allows the user to edit any item on the menu. It does so by means of the performFieldUpdate method in the Item class.
      Parameters:
      connection - The Connection resource from the main method which is needed to invoke the performFieldUpdate method.
      input - The Scanner instance from the main method needed to read user input with the utility class UserInput.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If the underlying MySQL service fails.

    • captureNewDriver

      public static void captureNewDriver(Connection connection, Scanner input) throws SQLException
      A method to capture a new driver into the database. The addition is completely handled by the createDriver method in the Driver class.
      Parameters:
      connection - The Connection resource from the main method that is needed to invoke the createDriver method.
      input - The Scanner instance from the main method that is also needed for the invocation of the createDriver method.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If the underlying MySQL service fails.

    • editDriver

      public static void editDriver(Connection connection, Scanner input) throws SQLException
      This method allows the user to edit any of the details of an existing driver. It does so with the help of the performFieldUpdate method in the Driver class.
      Parameters:
      connection - The Connection resource from the main method needed for the invocation of the performFieldUpdate method.
      input - The Scanner instance from the main method needed to read user input with the help of the utility class UserInput.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If the underlying MySQL service fails.
